<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The LiveIntervalCalc class is an extension of LiveRangeCalc targeted to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// computation and modification of the LiveInterval variants of LiveRanges.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LiveIntervals are meant to track liveness of registers and stack slots and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LiveIntervalCalc adds to LiveRangeCalc all the machinery required to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// construct the liveness of virtual registers tracked by a LiveInterval.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If @p LR is a main range, or if @p LI is null, then all uses must be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// jointly dominated by the definitions from @p LR. If @p LR is a subrange</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the live interval @p LI, corresponding to lane mask @p LaneMask,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// all uses must be jointly dominated by the definitions from @p LR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// together with definitions of other lanes where @p LR becomes undefined</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (via &lt;def,read-undef&gt; operands).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If @p LR is a main range, the @p LaneMask should be set to ~0, i.e.</Highlight></CodeLine>
